channel.title: Jar file error could not find or load main class client
channel.description:
So i tryed to make a jar file and when i was done and tryed to run i getting this error:could not find or load main class client. can someone help me?
Thanks,
Rowin

sk8rdude461 really thanks man you helped me fast !!! keep going ^^

item.title: Jar file error could not find or load main class client

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“rowin16, post:13, topic:527305”]Thanks sk8rdude461 !!! it worked for me!!!

really thanks man but next question lol… I have now the client and a bat file what if i give them to anyone else they need to run the bath to or can thye just press on the client??? if they need to press on the runbath can i make them just clicking on the client icon??[/quote]
They can just double click the client icon. the bat file isn’t needed.

so what have i to do now?

Make the .jar exactly like you did before, but instead of where you click the button and type “client” type in RunClient

item.title: Jar file error could not find or load main class client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“rowin16, post:9, topic:527305”]public static void main(String[] strings) {
for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
if (strings[i].equalsIgnoreCase(“servaddr”))
mainurl = strings[++i];
}
RunClient runclient = new RunClient();
runclient.doFrame();
its in my runclient[/quote]
Yeah it’s RunClient.

Read full topic

for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
if (strings[i].equalsIgnoreCase(“servaddr”))
mainurl = strings[++i];
}
RunClient runclient = new RunClient();
runclient.doFrame();
its in my runclient

I think it’s: RunClient
but what the hell is this? servaddr
Is there really a file or args that’s named that in your client…

item.source: Jar file error could not find or load main class client

item.title: Jar file error could not find or load main class client
item.dc:creator: @rowin16 rowin16
item.description:
@rowin16 wrote:

@echo off
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin/javaw.exe” -cp clientlibs.jar; RunClient servaddr Spitfirersps.no-ip.biz
pause

If you that mean with : So I believe the manifest will be Loader or loader (caps are specific.) If you want to know what one it is for sure post your run.bat code for the client on here

Read full topic

item.source: Jar file error could not find or load main class client

item.title: Jar file error could not find or load main class client
item.dc:creator: @Samih1996 Samih1996
item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

when you compile, it turns into client.class. So when you create the jar file, your in your manifest template it should just be ‘client’. So where it says Main-Class put there ‘client’ if that doesnt work it could be ‘loader’ depending on which version client you have.

Read full topic
